title: Tariffs and stock markets: A glossary to help understand the crisis sparked by Trump
summary: Capitulation, protectionism, safe haven asset, bear market: Le Monde put together a glossary of vocabulary to grasp the economic stakes behind US President Donald Trump's tariff increases.

title: Is Bitcoin a safe haven?
summary: Often described as 'digital gold,' the most famous cryptocurrency has seen its value drop by more than 9% since April 2.

title: US-China confrontation overshadows Trump's 'beautiful' trade war
summary: Thursday's market losses followed giddy gains on Wednesday in the aftermath of a stunning Trump climbdown, where he maintained a 10% blanket tariff on most countries but paused plans for tariffs of 20% on the EU and even higher levies on multiple other trade partners.

title: Denmark poised to strengthen military cooperation with the US
summary: Amid a diplomatic crisis with Washington, Danish MPs are set to ratify the defense agreement signed in December 2023, which will grant the United States unlimited access to three Danish bases for 10 years.

title: Infant mortality: France lags behind other UE countries
summary: According to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE), one in 250 children died in 2024 before their first birthday. The government has since announced a registry on infant mortality to determine the exact causes.

title: At the Cannes Film Festival, six women compete and Julia Ducournau and Wes Anderson return
summary: The official selection for the event, which takes place from May 13 to May 24 and is presided over by Juliette Binoche, was announced in Paris on April 10.

title: Six dead in NYC after sightseeing helicopter crash in Hudson River
summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said that a family of tourists, including three children, were among the six people killed on Thursday.

title: Tesla opens first showroom in oil-rich Saudi Arabia
summary: Naseem Akbarzada, Tesla country manager for Saudi Arabia, hailed the start of a 'long-term presence' on Thursday. Meanwhile, showrooms in the US have been attacked, with sales slumping ever since billionaire owner Elon Musk got involved with the Trump administration.

title: US Supreme Court: Trump administration must facilitate return of man wrongly deported to El Salvador prison
summary: The court acted in the case of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a Salvadoran citizen who had an immigration court order preventing his deportation to his native country over fears he would face persecution from local gangs.

title: RFK Jr. says US will find cause of autism by September
summary: Despite scientific consensus that vaccines don't cause autism and research showing genes play a role, Kennedy announced that the nation's top health agency will undertake a 'massive testing and research effort.'

title: Germany's Merz unveils his coalition deal on illegal immigration, taxes and bureaucracy
summary: The document was negotiated behind closed doors between the Christian Democrats and the Social Democrats. Besides the chancellery, the CDU-CSU will lead the ministries of economy, foreign affairs, education and health, while the SPD takes over the Finance Ministry.

title: The UK's Labour government is at odds with its left wing
summary: Faced with budgetary constraints and rising defense spending, Labour is preparing to cut social expenditures – at the risk of alienating the left wing of the party.

title: Macron announces potential recognition of Palestinian state in June
summary: In an interview on French television on Wednesday, the French president expressed his desire to 'participate in a collective dynamic' also leading to recognition of Israel by 'all those who defend Palestine.'

title: Tariffs: Amid unpredictable US policies, Europe hopes to win back investor favor
summary: The land of Donald Trump is losing its appeal for some investors. The prospect of Europe's rearmament and more accommodative budgetary policies is encouraging the return of capital to the Old Continent.

title: Iran threatens to expel UN nuclear inspectors ahead of US talks
summary: Washington responded, warning that expelling IAEA inspectors from Iran would be an 'escalation and a miscalculation on Iran's part.'

title: US and Russia swap prisoners as both sides seek to rebuild ties
summary: Moscow released a US-Russian ballet dancer jailed for a small donation to a Ukrainian charity, while Washington freed a Russian-German accused of exporting electronics to Russia's military.

title: Cannes Film Festival promises to tackle sexual abuse
summary: Iris Knobloch, the head of the French film festival, said that it would look into the findings of a parliamentary inquiry into abuse in the entertainment sector, insisting that women were 'finally being heard.'

title: Souvlaki: A recipe for bringing Greek society together
summary: Introduced by refugees from Asia Minor who arrived in Athens in the 1920s, the grilled meat sandwich with tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki has become a staple of local street food, uniting all social classes.

title: Panama deal allows US to deploy troops to canal, but no permanent bases
summary: Donald Trump, since returning to power in January, has vowed to 'take back' control of the strategic waterway that the United States funded, built and controlled until 1999.

title: In Paris, the over-ticketing of 'undesirables': A 'useless and counterproductive' policy
summary: In a study published on Wednesday, April 9, two researchers highlighted the biases in the police's use of 'public space eviction' strategies against certain population groups in the Paris region.

title: A temporary tariff truce between the US and Europe
summary: After securing assurance that Washington was ready to negotiate, the European Commission suspended its recent retaliatory measures.

title: Argentina once again confronts its past as refuge for Nazis
summary: The government announces the declassification of new documents, including 'banking and financial operations' that allegedly facilitated the escape from Europe and the settlement in South America of high-ranking officials from Hitler's totalitarian regime.

title: Dominicans begin to hold funerals for victims of the tragic nightclub roof collapse: 'No one will be left unidentified'
summary: Efforts have shifted from rescuing live victims to recovering bodies from the rubble of the Jet Set club in the country's capital. The official death toll is at least 221 as of Thursday, with numbers expected to rise following the nation's worst tragedy in decades.

title: Oscars unveil Best Stunt Design category
summary: The new statuette will be awarded for the first time at the 100th ceremony in 2028.

title: EU agrees  ban on hazardous substances in toys
summary: The text, which will only come into force once it has been officially adopted by the member states and the European Parliament, bans PFAS, unless they are inaccessible to children, and targets endocrine disruptors.

title: A Hong Kong billionaire's Panama ports get caught up in China-US rivalry
summary: The Panamanian government is resisting the whims of the head of the Pentagon to establish American bases there. Businessman Li Ka-shing and his conglomerate CK Hutchison, which manages the port terminals, find themselves in an inextricable geopolitical game.

title: China hits back by raising tariffs on US goods from 84% to 125%
summary: These countermeasure tariffs will come into effect on Saturday.

title: "Reducing 'Adolescence' to a societal debate marks its triumph, but signals the defeat of art"
summary: The British series has exceeded 100 million views worldwide since it launched on Netflix in March. While it stands out for its innovative form, it has been reduced, even by its creators, to a societal debate, analyzes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: French researcher jailed by Russia sent to penal colony, says family
summary: Laurent Vinatier is one of several Westerners who have been jailed for violating Russia's 'foreign agent' law.
